definitions.definition: clean with water and, typically, soap or detergent.
examples: I stripped and washed myself all over

definitions.definition: clean oneself, especially one's hands and face with soap and water.
examples: clean oneself; Morebathe, take a bath, shower, soak, freshen up; formalperform one's ablutions "he is washing in the guest bathroom"Morebathe, take a bath, shower, soak, freshen up; perform one's ablutions he is washing in the guest bathroom

definitions.definition: (with reference to a stain or dirt) remove or be removed by cleaning with water and detergent.
examples: they have to keep washing the mold off the walls

definitions.definition: (of fabric, a garment, or dye) withstand cleaning to a specified degree without shrinking or fading.
examples: a linen-mix yarn that washes well

definitions.definition: do one's laundry.
examples: I need someone to cook and wash for me

definitions.definition: wet or moisten (something) thoroughly.
examples: you are beautiful with your face washed with rain

definitions.definition: (of flowing water) carry (someone or something) in a particular direction.
be carried by flowing water.
examples: an oil slick washed up on the beaches
synonyms: be beached "it washed up on my front lawn"

definitions.definition: (especially of waves) sweep, move, or splash in a particular direction.
examples: the sea began to wash along the decks

definitions.definition: (of a river, sea, or lake) flow through or lap against (a country, coast, etc.).
examples: offshore islands washed by warm blue seas

definitions.definition: sift metallic particles from (earth or gravel) by running water through it.
brush with a thin coat of diluted paint or ink.
examples: the walls were washed with shades of umber

definitions.definition: coat inferior metal with (a film of gold or silver from a solution).
seem convincing or genuine.
examples: charm won't wash with this crew
synonyms: bear scrutiny; do "this story just won't wash"

definitions.definition: an act of washing something or an instance of being washed.
examples: clean, shower, dip, bath, soak; ablutions she needs a wash

definitions.definition: a quantity of clothes needing to be or just having been washed.
examples: she hung out her Tuesday wash
synonyms: washing "that shirt should go in the wash"

definitions.definition: a medicinal or cleansing solution.
the disturbed water or air behind a moving boat or aircraft or the sound made by this.
the surging of water or breaking of waves or the sound made by this.
examples: the wash of waves on the pebbled beach
synonyms: splash "the wash of the waves on the beach"

definitions.definition: a layer of paint or metal spread thinly on a surface.
examples: the walls were covered with a pale lemon wash

definitions.definition: silt or gravel carried by a stream or river and deposited as sediment.
a sandbank exposed only at low tide.
(in the western US) a dry bed of a stream, typically in a ravine, that flows only seasonally.
kitchen slops and other food waste fed to pigs.
malt fermenting in preparation for distillation.
a situation or result that is of no benefit to either of two opposing sides.
examples: the plan's impact on jobs would be a wash, creating as many as it costs
